definitions.body: :Is 5:10) bath (Thes al. fr. above √ in sense of define, measure; cf. te/mnw; Lag:Or. ii. 10 f. makes = [[בדת]], = [[בד]] + fem. [[ת]]; cf. Syr. bat=a, instrument for pressing olives; cf. Epiphan. ba/dov = e)laiotribei=on; & ba/dov also Hesych. Jos:Ant. viii. 2. 9 but ed. Niese ba/touv, ba/tov—´[[בּ]] abs. Is 5:10 + 6 t.; ([[בָָּת]] Ez Eze 45:11) cstr. Ez Eze 45:10; pl. [[בַּתִּים]] 2Ch 2:9, 2Ch 2:9 + 3 t.;—a liquid measure = [[אֵיפָה]] of dry measure, each being 1/10 [[חׂמֶר]] (q.v.) Ez Eze 45:11, Eze 45:11, Eze 45:14, Eze 45:14; also Is 5:10, 1Ki 7:26, 1Ki 7:38, 2Ch 2:9, 2Ch 2:9, 2Ch 4:5 + Ez Eze 45:14, Eze 45:14 (4 t. in this v., Co del. a & d). Ez Eze 45:10 [[בַּת־חֶדֶק]] a righteous (right, accurate, full) bath (‖[[אֵיפַת־חֶדֶק]]). The actual size of bath (= ephah) is appar. c. 40 litres (= Attic metretes cf. Jos:Ant. viii. 2. 9; = 39.39 lit. cf. Boeckh:Metrol. Untersuch. 259 f.; v. also J. Brandis:Münz- Mass- u. Gewichtswesen 29 f. Smith:Dict. Bible, art. Weights & Measures Ri:HWB 934 f.).—1. [[בַּת]] v. sub [[בֵּן]].
